clinical_study.brief_title: Positioning and Ultrasound Examination of the Gastric Antrum
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Positioning on Ultrasound Examination of the Gastric Antrum

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this prospective study was to assess the effect of patient positioning on the ultrasound assessment of gastric contents.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in ultrasound measurement of the antral cross sectional area according to the position
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 20 min
primary_outcome.description: Ultrasound measurement of antral cross-sectional area

primary_outcome.measure: Change in qualitative ultrasound assessment of gastric contents according to the position
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 20 min
primary_outcome.description: qualitative ultrasound assessment of gastric contents

arm_group.description: patient in supine position, lying on the back, turned in the right lateral decubitus and turned in the left lateral decubitus in a randomized way, after prolonged fasting and 10 min after free oral intake of water

patient in semirecumbent position (head of the bed elevated to 30°), lying on the back, turned in the right lateral decubitus and turned in the left lateral decubitus in a randomized way, after prolonged fasting and 10 min after free oral intake of water

patient in semirecumbent position (head of the bed elevated to 45°), lying on the back, turned in the right lateral decubitus and turned in the left lateral decubitus in a randomized way, after prolonged fasting and 10 min after free oral intake of water
patient in semirecumbent position (head of the bed elevated to 90°), lying on the back, after prolonged fasting and 10 min after free oral intake of water

intervention.intervention_name: 6 hours fasting and free oral intake of water
intervention.description: Ultrasound examination of the gastric antrum are performed in volunteers after prolonged fasting and 10 min after oral intake of water. Volunteer should be lying on his/her back, right lateral decubitus position and left lateral decubitus position with randomization of the order.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA 1 and 2 volunteers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes mellitus
- previous gastrointestinal surgery
- Medication affecting gastric motility
- digestive diseases, gastroparesis
- Pregnancy
